Description: Silent Hill is a horror video game series known for its eerie, gloomy, and gothic art style. The conceptual art of the series, including its environments and characters, has been influential in the horror gaming genre. Key figures include Hideo Kojima, Shinji Mikami, and Masahiro Ito.

Title: Simon Bisley
Description: Simon Bisley is a British comic book artist known for his dynamic and epic style in fantasy art. His illustrative work is often characterized by dramatic compositions and muscular figures. Artists with similar styles include Frank Frazetta, Boris Vallejo, and Mike Mignola.

Title: Simon Stalenhag
Description: Simon Stalenhag is a Swedish artist known for his concept art in the genre of science fiction. His style presents melancholic, post-apocalyptic landscapes blended with elements of retro-futurism. Artists with similar themes include H.R. Giger, Syd Mead, and Mike Winkelmann.

Title: Sir William Russell Flint
Description: Sir William Russell Flint was a British artist recognized for his figurative and impressionistic style, often romantic in mood. His work primarily involved paintings of women. Artists with similar styles include John Singer Sargent, James McNeill Whistler, and Edgar Degas.

Title: Sitting Portrait
Description: A sitting portrait is a style of portraiture where the subject is depicted in a sitting position. This style is prevalent in painting and can span multiple art styles, though it's often associated with realism. Renowned artists for this style include Leonardo da Vinci, Rembrandt van Rijn, and Pablo Picasso.

Title: Skatepunk
Description: Skatepunk refers to a subculture that combines elements of skateboarding and punk music, often reflected in street and graffiti art. This style is characteristically rebellious, using bold, graphic compositions in urban environments. Artists associated with this style include Shepard Fairey, Banksy, and RETNA.

Title: Sketchnote
Description: Sketchnoting, also known as visual note-taking, is a style that combines drawing and text to convey ideas or notes. It's part illustration and part graphic design. Prominent figures in this field include Mike Rohde, Sunni Brown, and Dan Roam.

Title: Skinhead Fashion
Description: Skinhead Fashion is a style of fashion originating from a British working-class subculture. It is often associated with rebellious street and graffiti art in urban environments. Brands associated with this style include Fred Perry, Dr. Martens, and Ben Sherman.

Title: Skottie Young
Description: Skottie Young is a comic book artist and writer known for his humorous and caricatured style. His illustrations often contain exaggerated features and humorous elements. Artists with similar styles include Mike Mignola, Jim Lee, and Neal Adams.

Title: Skullpunk
Description: Skullpunk is a subculture art style that heavily features skull motifs, often with an edgy, gothic aesthetic. This style is seen across various forms of visual art and is associated with artists such as H.R. Giger, Shepard Fairey, and Banksy.

Title: Slim Aarons
Description: Slim Aarons was a photographer known for his candid, lighthearted depictions of the rich and famous. His style often captured the luxurious environments and lifestyles of his subjects. Other photographers with a similar focus include Horst P. Horst, Richard Avedon, and Helmut Newton.

Title: Slow Shutter Speed
Description: Slow shutter speed is a photography technique often used in long exposure and landscape photography. It allows for the capture of movement in a fluid and often surreal way, particularly in low light settings. Artists known for this technique include Michael Kenna, Alexey Titarenko, and Hiroshi Sugimoto.

Title: Low Light
Description: Low Light style art uses low lighting conditions to create a mysterious mood, typically employing a focused composition. This style is closely associated with Tenebrism, Film Noir, and Gothic Art.

Title: Snowglobe
Description: A snowglobe is a decorative object that encapsulates a miniature scene or design, often associated with festive or winter themes. The style is characterized by its enclosed composition and joyful mood. Artists like Walter Martin, Paloma Munoz, and David Levinthal have created works that resonate with this aesthetic.

Title: Warm Tones
Description: The Warm Tones color style involves the use of warm tones, often seen in Impressionism, Post-Impressionism, and Fauvism. This style, typically set in outdoor environments under natural light, creates a comforting mood with loose, fluid compositions. Notable artists include Claude Monet and Vincent van Gogh.

Title: Black and White
Description: The Black and White color style is defined by the use of black and white, predominantly seen in photography and film. Set in both indoor and outdoor environments with contrasting light, this style imparts a dramatic mood through compositions focused on light and shadow. Artists such as Ansel Adams and Henri Cartier-Bresson are associated with this style.

Title: Artificial Light
Description: Artificial Light style art is characterized by the use of artificial lighting, often creating a dramatic mood. The composition is usually focused or centralized. This style is commonly associated with Film Noir, Neon Art, and Digital Art.

Title: Strong Emphasis on Lines and Shapes
All Hues of the Color Spectrum
